titleStmt.title: J. K. Jewell to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7325

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency Tho E Bramlette
Goveror of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your petitioner James Jewell states that he was indicted by a grand Jury of Woodford County for suffering and permitting games of chance, hazard, and cards upon which money &c was bet, won, and lost, in a house in Versailles in his possession and under his controle.

He states that he is a Keeper of a salloon in said town of Versailles, and that the charge in the indictment that games of hazard were played in his house for property was true. because cigars and whiskey were played for, won and lost

After the indictment was found against him he learned from his counsel that permitting even a cigar or drink of whiskey to be played for was a violation of law and made him subject to the fine imposed by the Statute. Knowing it to be true that such things had been. bet, won, and lost, in his house and after finding the Commission of such thingsacts to be unlawful. and not not wishing to deny a charge that was true, he, at the Oct Term 1865 of the Woodford Circuit Court, confessed
Judgment and Judgment was rendered against him for $200.
Petitioner has given your excellency a history of the case and believes he is Justified in asking clemency at your hands. He therefore prays that you will remit so much of said fine ^as^ you can
